intro: Ceropegia yemenensis, commonly known as the Yemen arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to Yemen and parts of Saudi Arabia. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, tuberous roots and succulent stems. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it well adapted to drought conditions. Ceropegia yemenensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some regions.
